description: Achillea millefolium, commonly known as yarrow, is a herbaceous plant often used for its anti-inflammatory and wound-healing properties.
Allium sativum, commonly known as garlic, is a bulbous plant widely recognized for its antimicrobial, cardiovascular, and immune-boosting properties.
Aloe vera is a succulent plant that stores water in its leaves. It is famous for its skin-soothing, wound-healing, and digestive-aid properties.
Alpinia officinarum, or lesser galangal, is a perennial herb used primarily in traditional medicine for digestive complaints and inflammatory conditions.
Angelica sinensis, or Dong Quai, is a well-known herb in traditional Chinese medicine used primarily for female reproductive health and blood circulation.
Apium graveolens, or celery, is known both as a food and medicine, particularly for its anti-inflammatory, digestive, and diuretic properties.
Arctium lappa, or burdock, is a biennial plant known for its detoxifying effects, used to treat skin conditions and as a blood purifier.
Artemisia absinthium, commonly known as wormwood, is a perennial herb known for its bitter properties and its use in digestive disorders.
Atropa belladonna, or deadly nightshade, is a highly toxic plant used in minute amounts for its anticholinergic properties.
Calendula officinalis, or marigold, is known for its skin-healing properties and is used in treating wounds, rashes, and inflammation.
Capsicum annuum and Capsicum frutescens are species of chili pepper widely used for their digestive, circulatory, and anti-inflammatory benefits.
Cassia senna, or senna, is a well-known laxative used to relieve constipation.
Rumex crispus, or yellow dock, is a herbaceous plant used for its detoxifying and mild laxative effects.
Chamomilla recutita, also known as German chamomile, is a popular medicinal herb used for its calming, anti-inflammatory, and digestive properties.
Chrysanthemum x morifolium is a hybrid species widely used in herbal medicine for its anti-inflammatory and detoxifying effects.
Cimicifuga racemosa, or black cohosh, is traditionally used to relieve menopausal symptoms and menstrual disorders.
Citrus limon, commonly known as lemon, is prized for its high vitamin C content and is used to treat a variety of ailments, including colds and digestive issues.
Codonopsis pilosula, or Dang Shen, is an adaptogenic herb used in Traditional Chinese Medicine to boost energy and support the immune system.
Commiphora molmol, or myrrh, is a resin used in traditional medicine for its antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and wound-healing properties.
Curcuma longa, commonly known as turmeric, is a rhizome widely used in cooking and for its powerful anti-inflammatory effects.
Dioscorea villosa, or wild yam, is a vine whose tuber is used for women's health, especially in menopause and menstrual disorders.
Echinacea spp., commonly known as Echinacea, is a herb renowned for its immune-boosting properties.
Elettaria cardamomum, or cardamom, is a fragrant spice known for its digestive benefits and antioxidant properties.
Eleutherococcus senticosus, also called Siberian ginseng, is an adaptogenic herb used to enhance physical endurance and reduce stress.
Eucalyptus globulus, commonly known as eucalyptus, is a tall evergreen tree used primarily for respiratory health and its antiseptic properties.
Eugenia caryophyllata, or clove, is a spice used for its analgesic and antiseptic properties, particularly in dental care.
Filipendula ulmaria, or meadowsweet, is a flowering plant used for its anti-inflammatory and pain-relieving properties.
Gentiana lutea, commonly known as gentian, is a bitter herb used to stimulate digestion.
Ginkgo biloba, or ginkgo, is an ancient tree species used to enhance cognitive function and improve circulation.
Glycyrrhiza glabra, commonly known as licorice, is a root used for its soothing and anti-inflammatory properties, especially for the digestive and respiratory systems.
Hamamelis virginiana, or witch hazel, is a shrub known for its astringent properties, commonly used in skincare for its soothing effects.
Harpagophytum procumbens, commonly called Devil's Claw, is a herb known for its anti-inflammatory and pain-relieving effects, particularly for arthritis.
Humulus lupulus, or hops, is a flowering plant known for its sedative properties, often used to support sleep and relaxation.
Hypericum perforatum, or St. John's Wort, is a flowering plant widely used for its antidepressant and mood-stabilizing effects.
Inula helenium, commonly known as elecampane, is a root herb used for its expectorant properties, particularly in respiratory conditions.
Lavandula angustifolia, commonly known as lavender, is an aromatic herb used for its calming effects and in the treatment of anxiety, insomnia, and stress-related conditions.
Linum usitatissimum, or flaxseed, is a herbaceous plant valued for its seeds, which are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and fiber, used for digestive health and cardiovascular support.
Melaleuca alternifolia, known as tea tree, is a small tree or shrub, renowned for its potent antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties, particularly in skin infections.
Melissa officinalis, or lemon balm, is a herbaceous plant with a lemon scent, commonly used to reduce stress, anxiety, and to improve sleep.
Mentha x piperita, commonly known as peppermint, is a hybrid mint used for digestive issues, pain relief, and respiratory health.
Ocimum tenuiflorum, known as holy basil, is a sacred plant in Indian culture, used to enhance immunity, reduce stress, and support respiratory health.
Paeonia lactiflora, or Chinese peony, is a herbaceous plant used in traditional Chinese medicine for its anti-inflammatory, antispasmodic, and analgesic properties.
Panax ginseng, a perennial plant in the Araliaceae family, is widely known for its adaptogenic properties and is often used to enhance physical stamina and mental performance.
Passiflora incarnata, or passionflower, is a climbing vine with calming properties, traditionally used to treat anxiety and insomnia.
Pelargonium sidoides, a flowering plant in the Geraniaceae family, is commonly used to treat respiratory infections due to its antimicrobial properties.
Plantago spp. refers to a group of species known for their wound-healing and anti-inflammatory properties, often used in herbal medicine for digestive and respiratory issues.
Rehmannia glutinosa, a key herb in Traditional Chinese Medicine, is used for its rejuvenating properties, particularly in supporting kidney and adrenal health.
Rheum palmatum, commonly known as Chinese rhubarb, is used for its potent laxative and detoxifying properties.
Rhodiola rosea, a perennial flowering plant, is known for its adaptogenic properties, helping to reduce fatigue and improve resilience to stress.
Rosmarinus officinalis, or rosemary, is a fragrant herb widely used for its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, particularly in improving memory and digestion.
Salix alba, or white willow, is known for its analgesic and anti-inflammatory properties, often used as a natural alternative to aspirin.
Salvia miltiorrhiza, also known as Danshen, is used in Traditional Chinese Medicine to improve cardiovascular health and treat circulation problems.

Salvia officinalis, commonly known as sage, is a perennial, evergreen subshrub with grayish leaves and blue to purplish flowers. It is well known for its antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.

Schisandra chinensis, known as the five-flavor berry, is a deciduous woody vine whose berries are used in Traditional Chinese Medicine for their adaptogenic and liver-protective properties.
Scutellaria baicalensis, or Baikal skullcap, is a flowering plant used in Traditional Chinese Medicine for its potent anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.

research_on_medicinal_properties: Studies suggest yarrow has significant anti-inflammatory and wound-healing effects, due to its flavonoid content.
Extensive research confirms garlic's cardiovascular benefits, including reducing blood pressure and cholesterol levels.
Aloe vera has been researched for its skin healing, moisturizing, and anti-inflammatory properties, particularly in burn treatment.
Lesser galangal shows promise in its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, though more clinical studies are required.
Angelica sinensis is widely studied for its role in regulating menstruation and improving blood flow in traditional Chinese medicine.
Celery has been found to exhibit anti-inflammatory and antihypertensive effects in animal studies.
Burdock root has been shown to possess strong antioxidant properties and has been traditionally used for detoxification.
Research shows wormwood has antiparasitic effects and may support digestive health by stimulating bile production.
Atropa belladonna's alkaloids have been studied for their anticholinergic effects, which are useful in treating muscle spasms and certain types of poisoning.
